results.title: Half of mankind
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Films Division, Government of India and United Nations
results.brief_description: This film deals with community development in Asia. The village is the unit of organization on which Asia rests, and it is the basis of community development. Three examples are shown: simple self-help in Cambodia; villages cooperating with the World Health Organization to run a health clinic in Afghanistan; interdependence of the agricultural and industrial communities in India, with cash crops providing capital for agricultural development and mechanized expansion of village crafts with the aid of electricity.

results.title: Summer school in Singapore
results.brief_description: As part of the Colombo Plan thirty-five students from Cambodia and Laos were invited by the United Kingdom Government to attend a summer-school in Singapore for a six-week course in the English language. The school was held in the University of Malaya and the students came from varied walks of life - government officials, teachers and high-school students. Emphasis was laid on conversational English, its rhythm, pronunciation and vocabulary.

results.title: A Bridge in music
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Alexander Shaw and Unesco
results.brief_description: Yehudi Menuhin and Eastern musician Ayana Deva Angadi compare Eastern and Western music and discuss how we can come to understand and appreciate that which is foreign to us in terms of that which is familiar. Characteristic techniques are shown, and the film includes examples of music from India, Japan, Cambodia, Italy, Germany and France.

results.title: Angkor, the lost city
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Angkor - a whole metropolis of palaces and temples recovered from the jungle which hid them for centuries until discovered in 1860 by a French naturalist. Monuments, picture tapestries in stone and Angkor Vat, a mile square temple of grey sandstone which no other church has rivalled in size, reveal the glories of the past empire of the Khmers, ancestors of the Cambodians.

results.title: The Melbourne Concert Hall
results.creator_credit: David Greig, David Morgan, The Victorian Arts Centre and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description: Interviews with architects, administrators, interior designers, construction workers and others associated with the construction of the Melbourne Concert Hall. Artists who have performed at the venue also give their opinion of hall. Those interviewed include: Roy Ground, Neil Haysom, Theodore Schultz, Ken Myer, John Truscott and Kenny Christophers. Shows segments from performances by Jackie Love, Cleo Laine, Sylvio Gualdo, Karen Knowles, London Early Music Group, Mondo Rock, the guitarist John Williams, Brian May’s Melbourne Showband and conductors Piero Gamba, Patrick Thomas and John Hopkins. Views of Melbourne’s skyline capture the Gas and Fuel buildings that were demolished to accommodate Federation Square.

results.brief_description: A revealing documentary about the lives of six unemployed teenagers in the Ballarat region. It was made by the unemployed themselves.

results.title: Southeast Asia: a culture history
results.creator_credit: Arthur Niehoff and Sigma Educational Films
results.brief_description: Explains the cultures of Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia and Thailand as a blend of indigenous tribal traditions and the high culture of Hindu-Buddhist India. Discusses how former centres of empire stand as testimony to the endurance of Buddhist and Brahman idea systems in Southeast Asia. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Explains the cultures of Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia and Thailand as a blend of indigenous tribal traditions and the high culture of Hindu-Buddhist India. Discusses how former centres of empire stand as testimony to the endurance of Buddhist and Brahman idea systems in Southeast Asia. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The International Court of Justice
results.creator_credit: Karl Van der Ploeg, Janine Hamel-Minne and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: The origin of the concept of international law and the evolvement of the role of the International Court of Justice in the Hague, in deciding legal disputes between States. Its work and function are illustrated in the controversy between Norway and the United Kingdom concerning fishing rights, the disputed frontier land between Belgium and the Netherlands, and the dispute between Cambodia and Thailand regarding the territorial sovereignty of a holy monastery.

results.title: [Tony Agapitos: Easter celebrations at Green Hill]
results.brief_description:
This film shows Greek Easter celebrations, including a community BBQ, cooking lamb on a spit, music and dancing.

This film is part of a collection of 16mm films made by Tony Agapitos. The collection offers a glimpse at Greek migrant life in Victoria from the 1950s to the 1970s.

results.title: [Wallace Clarke Home Movies: Reel 33]
results.brief_description:
Wallace Clarke was an amateur filmmaker during the 1960s to the 1990s. Wallace was particularly keen on capturing both the Australian landscape and the people who enjoyed it. As well as Australian urban settings and some world travels, Wallace’s films focus on the many hiking and camping destinations that he visited.

Often carrying the credit, ‘A Walkabout Film’, Wallace’s movies indicate that he was part of a nature study and walking group called ‘The Walkabouters Club of Victoria Inc’. The ‘Walkabouters’ formed in 1968 as a result of a Council of Adult Education (CAE), Outback Study Tour to Central Australia’. Some of the attendees decided to start the Club in order to continue educative walks particularly around Victoria. The Club encouraged their resident artists and photographers to capture their activities.

The collection of Wallace’s films was donated to ACMI by his widow Gwenda Clarke.

This film shows a trip to Wilson’s Promontory, Victoria including the beach at Tidal River and a group of people hiking around the prom.

Originally made on Standard 8mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:38:00 a banksia tree
00:01:02:00 group of people walking onto a beach with large boulders
00:01:37:00 taking photos on the shoreline
00:02:35:00 woman sketching
00:05:49:00 a little lizard
00:06:27:00 group of people hiking
00:07:43:00 man sitting on a rock looking over a view
00:08:05:00 group of people watching the view
00:09:56:00 the river going into the sea
00:12:23:00 the footbridge at Tidal River
00:14:12:00 a rosella on a branch and feeding from someone’s hand
